channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: No lighting, 8th January
item.description:
No street lighting on Manor Park from the bus stop to house 56

item.title: Advert fixed to telegraph post, 8th January
item.description:
No damage, but fly posted advert for removal services without business address seems dodgy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beverley Road, Barnehurst, Greater London

item.title: Drain entirely blocked internally, 8th January
item.description:
Hi, There are 2 drains ob the corner and the one furthee up the road as indicated on the map is entirely blocked up internally causing the drain direct on the corner to become overwhelmed. I clear that drain regularly. The occupant on the corner bungalow is disabled and there us a concern that the water has been crossing the pavement and will freeze to ice causing a danger to pedestrians and cars also. Regards

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Corbylands Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, 8th January
item.description:
Large pot hole with 3 others right near to it. Dangerous for motorbikes and car tyres. The hole way round the roundabout is full of deep potholes , abd where it was oootky patched further round on the way back to cray road also cracking and other potholes!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cray Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chair and 2 mattresses, 8th January
item.description:
Items been dumped on the pavement and worried some one will use the chair to vandalise vehicles.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: Surface water flooding - Blocked plublic drain, 8th January
item.description:
There is so much Surface water flooding due to Blocked plublic drain. This drain constantly gets blocked and its about to block the pavement with water. Needs urgent clearing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellenden Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside number 40 on Grafton Way, 8th January
item.description:
The neighbours at number 30-40 have been suffering from a persistent, annoying, disruptive, disturbing, continuous noise that is affecting our lives. Please could Camden borough take responsibility for keeping the neighbours awake at night? This is a residential and more over, and oncology hospital area, where people are sick, and also get sick from convulsing noises like this one. Please Could you help us?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Grafton Way, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain outside 30 Durham Road, 8th January
item.description:
Water flowing straight over drain resulting in flooding further down Durham Road. Drain grate is clear, indicating blockage below grate as water flows over grate rather than into it. Drain in front of street bench, near house 30 Durham Road, Bromley. This is the 4th report at this location, as reports keep being closed without the issue actually being fixed, going back more than 2 years. One such report just resulted in the drain being tarmacced over instead of repaired and the fault closed. This drain being blocked means lower down Durham Road can't cope with the volume of water when it rains because this drain intercepts water coming down the hill from Durham Avenue & Westmoreland Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durham Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Offensive graffiti, 8th January
item.description:
Offensive graffiti, from Wikipedia: Brizz (uncountable) (MLE, slang, rare) Oral stimulation of the male member; a blowjob. Synonyms: top, slop, nod; see also Thesaurus:oral sex

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Grove Vale, East Dulwich, Greater London

item.title: Blocked drain outside 68 Durham Road, 8th January
item.description:
Blocked street drain outside 68 Durham Road. Drain cover/grating was clear, but water does not drain. This was reported in September, and the report closed without fixing the issue. Street cleaning will not resolve it, as it does not drain when the grating/cover is clear. Consequently this part of Durham Road floods when it rains.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88, Durham Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Car - not moved for 6 years., 8th January
item.description:
Abandoned on driveway of 27 Coleraine for over 6 years and causing a local environmental issue as well as an eyesore. Tyres completely flat and rotten. Suspected oil/fluid leak underneath
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Coleraine Road, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Redundant "road markings" should be removed in Randall Place, 8th January
item.description:
The "old" section of ZigZag markings are redundant and should be removed. This section of Randall Place is now allocated-parking for Residents and Business use. The "white" parking-demarcation lines also need to be re-painted. Refer to photos. NOTE: An opportunity was missed to do this work earlier in this week (06.01.26). Highway Maintenance were in attendance removing, and painting new "road markings" at the end of Roan Street (junction with Greenwich High Street)

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Randall Place, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees along Albion Channel (nr Mousetail Coffee) have sunk, 8th January
item.description:
Trees along the south east of Albion Channel, near Mousetail Coffee, between Canada Water and Surrey Quays Road appear to have sunk down in recent weeks. Can the council (or infrastructure owner) raise them to the correct height (level with footpath) to avoid an unnecessary trip hazard/accident please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Deal Porter Square, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Railings outside no 26/28 leaning into road make parking difficult., 8th January
item.description:
Railing was erected to protect a tree or its roots. The tree was removed some time ago. Now therefore no need for railings. Can they be removed please? They are right on the edge of pavement leaning into the road making parking there difficult. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Derwent Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Residents parking bays, 8th January
item.description:
The lines indicating the residents parking bays are virtually non-existent in Bkackthorn Grove DA7 4EH. This results in incorrect parking. Residents wanting to park are unable to do so because vehicles are parked incorrectly in the bays

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackthorn Grove, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
